clinical_study.brief_title: Pediatric Pelvic Injuries - Epidemiology and Demography
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiological Study of Pediatric Pelvic Injuries

brief_summary.textblock:
A retrospective epidemiological study of pediatric pelvic injury from level 1 trauma centre.
Hypothesis: In the pediatric population, majority of pelvic injuries is of type A according to AO/OTA (Arbeitsgemeinschaft für Osteosynthesefragen/Orthopaedic Trauma Association) classification, the treatment is mostly conservative and complications of injury and treatment are less common than in adults.

detailed_description.textblock: Study design: Retrospective analysis (13 years), excluding pathological fractures. AO/OTA type, epidemiological data, mode of treatment, and complications were recorded. Data were analyzed using the Fisher exact test and the Wilcoxon test.

primary_outcome.measure: Epidemiological study of pediatric pelvic trauma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Follow-up of each patient for minimum 12 months.
primary_outcome.description: The overall incidence of pelvic ring injury per 100,000 children per year. The overall incidence of isolated acetabular fractures per 100,000 children per year. The overall incidence of combined pelvic ring and acetabular injuries per 100,000 children per year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Demographical study of pediatric pelvic trauma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Follow-up of each patient for longer then 12 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the incidence of observed injuries by sex. Comparison of the incidence of observed injuries according to the severity of trauma (single trauma vs. multiple trauma). The incidence of the types of pelvic ring injury (according to AO/OTA classification) per 100,000 children per year.

arm_group.description: Paediatric patients (age ≤ 18 years) with a single pelvic bone fracture or pelvic ring injury, excluding pathological fractures.
Paediatric patients (age ≤ 18 years) with a combined pelvic and acetabular injury or an isolated acetabular fracture, excluding pathological fractures.

intervention.intervention_name: surgical treatment according to standard indication criteria
intervention.description: internal fixation according to standard indication criteria

intervention.intervention_name: conservative treatment according to standard indication criteria
intervention.description: conservative therapy according to standard indication criteria

study_pop.textblock: 358 patients (243 boys, 115 girls), mean age (SD) 14.1 ± 3.0 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria of primary study group:
- Age ≤ 18 years
- Single pelvic bone fractures or pelvic ring injuries
Inclusion Criteria of secondary study group:
- Age ≤ 18 years
- Combined pelvic and acetabular injuries
- Isolated fractures of the acetabulum
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pathological fractures
